title: Define Project Requirements
description: Collaborate with all stakeholders to identify, document, and prioritize functional and non-functional requirements. This includes edge cases, error handling, performance optimization considerations, and other applicable constraints. Ensure the requirements align with the goals of a reactive UI framework built on functional programming principles, emphasizing declarative UI descriptions and unidirectional data flow. To facilitate collaboration, break down requirements into smaller, manageable tasks as needed. Involve the code-architect for technical decisions and the project-manager to ensure alignment with project goals.

title: Design the Architecture
description: Develop a high-level design of the reactive UI framework, focusing on functional programming principles and unidirectional data flow

title: Implement Core Functionalities
description: Develop the core functionalities of the framework, such as declarative UI descriptions and reactive data binding

title: Create Test Cases
description: Write comprehensive unit tests and integration tests for the implemented functionalities of the FunctionalReactiveUIFramework project. Utilize industry-standard testing libraries such as Jest or Mocha to ensure maintainability, scalability, and efficiency. Collaborate with developers to develop a test suite that covers all aspects of the framework, including unidirectional data flow, declarative UI descriptions, and functional programming principles. Adopt Test-Driven Development (TDD) methodology for increased code quality and maintainability. To enhance clarity, I suggest adding examples or pseudocode snippets in the task description where necessary. Update the tests regularly to ensure compatibility with any future updates or additions to the framework. Upon completion, provide a detailed report summarizing the results of all test cases.

title: Perform Code Review
description: Review the code and ensure it adheres to design principles, best practices, and coding standards

title: Address Security Concerns
description: Review the code for potential security vulnerabilities and address any found issues

title: Deploy the Framework
description: Prepare and deploy the framework to a development environment for testing and validation
